title: Gallery: New Windows 10 laptops, desktops and tablets at CES

text:
Previous Next Lenovo ThinkPad X1 Carbon 
A host of new and updated Windows 10 computers are on show at this year's Consumer Electronics Show ( CES ) in Las Vegas. 
Here's a breakdown of the new desktops, laptops and tablets and what they have to offer: 
Lenovo ThinkPad X1 Carbon 
Available in Black or Silver, the new X1 lets users log in using their face or fingerprint, is thinner and lighter than its predecessor and has a longer battery life. 
Available in February from $1,350. 
Specs CPU: Seventh generation Intel processor up to Core i7 Display: 14-inch IPS display, up to 2560×1440 resolution Connectivity: 802.11ac Wi-Fi, WiGig, LTE-A wireless WAN Ports: Includes 2 Thunderbolt 3-compatible, 2 USB 3.0 Battery life: Up to 15.5 hours Weight: 2.5 pounds Image: Microsoft Lenovo ThinkPad X1 Yoga 
Like its predecessors, the convertible X1 Yoga laptop can be folded back on itself to be used as a kiosk-style display or tablet. This most recent outing has a keyboard that retracts into the body when used as a tablet, lets you log in with your face and is available with an OLED display, capable of deeper blacks and more vibrant images than most competing screen tech. 
Available in February, starting at $1,499. 
Specs CPU: Seventh generation Intel processor up to Core i7 Display: 14-inch, up to 2,560x1,440 OLED screen Storage: Up to 1TB of solid state storage Image: Microsoft Lenovo Miix 720 
A high-end tablet with a detachable keyboard, digital pen and kickstand, the Miix competes with Surface Pro but has better specs. 
Available with the keyboard from April, starting at $999.99. The Lenovo Active Pen 2 goes on sale in February from $59.99. 
Specs CPU: Seventh generation Intel processor up to Core i7 with integrated Intel HD Graphics 620 Memory: 16GB Storage: Up to 1TB PCIe SSD Ports: Includes 1 Thunderbolt 3 compatible Image: Microsoft Lenovo Legion Y720 Laptop 
Lenovo's new gaming laptop is thinner than its predecessor and is available with a high-end CPU and mid-range graphics card, capable of running VR titles. 
Available from April, starting at $1,399.99. 
Specs CPU: Seventh generation Intel processor Core i7 Memory: 16GB DDR4 Display: 17-inch, up to 3840 x 2160 IPS screen, driven by up to NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1060 6GB GPU Ports: Includes 1 Thunderbolt 3 compatible Image: Microsoft Lenovo ThinkPad X1 Tablet 
Similar to its predecessor but with a newer Intel Core processor, and faster wireless connectivity. The tablet also features an integrated projector for presentations away from the office. 
Available in the US for $949 in March. Image: Microsoft HP Sprout Pro G2 
Aimed at creatives, the Sprout Pro is a desktop PC with a built-in 2D/3D scanner, projector, cameras and Touch Mat with stylus. 
HP will announce pricing and availability in March 2017. 
Specs CPU: Seventh generation 2.9GHz Intel Core i7 7700T processor Memory: Up to 16GB of 2400MHz DDR4 Display: 2.2mm-thick, 35in, 20-point Touch Mat screen with a near-1080p projected resolution. Driven by Nvidia GeForce GTX 960M GPU Storage: Up to 1TB SSD Image: Microsoft HP EliteBook x360 
HP's thinnest and lightest convertible laptop/tablet, a business-focused device with facial log-in that comes with the latest Intel processor and a glass touchpad, as well as various security and privacy safeguards. 
Available at the end of this month in the US. 
Specs CPU: Seventh generation Intel processor up to Core i7, with Intel HD 620 graphics Memory: Up to 16GB of 2133MHz DDR4 Display: 13.3-inch, up to 3,840x2,160 resolution, Corning Gorilla Glass touch screen Storage: Up to 360GB M.2 SSD Ports: 1 USB Type-C port, 2 USB 3.1 ports, 1 HDMI 1.4 port, Micro-SIM card slot, microSD card reader, headphone/microphone combo jack Battery life: Up to 16 hours and 30 minutes Weight: 1.29kg Image: Microsoft HP Spectre x360 
The new Spectre is upgraded on several fronts, available with a sharper screen, bigger battery, wider glass trackpad, Bang and Olufsen speakers and facial log-in. However the top-end 15-inch version is slightly heavier and thicker than its predecessor. 
Available from the end of February in the US, starting at $1,279.99. 
Specs CPU: Seventh generation Intel processor Display: 15.6in, 3,840x2,160 resolution screen driven by up to NVIDIA GeForce 940MX GPU Ports: Includes HDMI-out, a USB Type-C and a Type-C port that also supports Thunderbolt 3, Battery life: Up to 12 hours Weight: 4.4 pounds Image: Microsoft HP ENVY Curve AIO 34 
HP's stylish all-in-one PC with a curved screen has a four-speaker sound bar, tuned by Bang & Olufsen. 
Available on HP.com from January 11 and from select retailers in February, starting at $1,729.99. 
Specs CPU: Seventh generation Intel processor up to Core i7 Memory: Up to 16GB DDR4 Display: 34in, 3440×1440 resolution screen driven by an optional Nvidia or AMD GPU Storage: Up to 256GB SSD and 2TB HDD Image: Microsoft Acer Aspire V Nitro Black Edition 
This updated entertainment focused-laptop has an aluminium cover, a precision touchpad, optional Tobii eye-tracking and a mid-range graphics cards for gaming and VR. 
Pricing for the 15-inch model starts at $1,199, and $1,399 for the 17-inch, both of which will be available in the US from February. 
Specs CPU: 7th Generation Intel Core i7-7700HQ processor Memory: Up to 32GB Display: 3,840x2,160-pixel screen, driven by up to NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1060 GPU with 6GB DDR5 RAM Storage: NVMe PCIe Gen 3 or SATA SSD and up to 2TB HDD Ports: Includes USB-C port with Thunderbolt 3, two USB 3.0 ports (one featuring power-off USB charging), two USB 2.0 ports and one HDMI Image: Microsoft Acer Aspire GX desktop PC 
The Acer Aspire GX desktop PC can be specced out as a powerful entertainment PC that can play the latest 3D games and VR experiences. 
Available in Europe in February with prices starting at €799. 
Specs CPU: Seventh generation Intel processor up to Core i7 Memory: Up to 64GB of DDR4 Display: Driven by up to Nvidia GeForce GTX 1070 GPU Image: Microsoft Acer Predator 21 X 
The new Predator is a powerful gaming laptop with Tobii eye-tracking tech, a mechanical keyboard, four speakers and two sub-woofers, and a custom fan setup, which will sell for a hefty price. Despite its entertainment focus, it also includes facial log-in and Skype for Business certification for clearer calls. 
Available from February, with prices starting at $8,999. 
Specs CPU: Seventh generation Intel Core i7-7820HK processor Memory: Up to 64GB of DDR4 memory Display: Curved 21-inch, NVIDIA G-SYNC compatible, IPS, 2560 x 1080 resolution screen, driven by dual NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1080 GPUs Storage: Up to four 512GB SSDs Ports: Includes USB-C port with Thunderbolt 3 Image: Microsoft Toshiba Portégé X20W 
A premium 2-in-1 convertible PC aimed at professionals and students, which can fold back to become a tablet, supports facial and fingerprint log-in, has a digital pen and includes a battery designed to last all day. 
Available "soon" via the Microsoft store. 
Specs CPU: Seventh generation Intel Core i7 processor Display: 12.5-inch, 1920 x 1080 resolution touchscreen Storage: SSD Connectivity: 802.11ac Wi-Fi Ports: Includes 1 USB Type-C port with Thunderbolt 3 support, USB 3.0 port and headphone/mic combo Battery life: Up to 16 hours Weight: < 2.5 pounds Image: Microsoft LG Gram 
With extra-long battery life, the latest version of the high-specced Gram laptop is also lighter and more powerful than its predecessors. 
Available in 13.3in, 14.0in and 15.6in models, pricing and availability will be announced at a later date. 
Specs CPU: Up to seventh generation Intel Core i7 processor Memory: Up to 16 GB DDR4 Display: 1,920 by 1,080-pixel resolution IPS touchscreen Storage: Up to 512 GB SSD Connectivity: 802.11ac Wi-Fi Ports: Includes 2 USB 3.0. 15.6in model includes 1 Thunderbolt and additional USB Type-C ports. Battery life: Up to about 24 hours for the 13.3in model according to LG, but probably closer to 17 hours according to other estimates Weight: 13.3in and 14in - 2.1 pounds. 15.6in - 2.4 pounds Image: Microsoft Samsung Notebook Odyssey 
This gaming laptop, available as a 15.6in and 17.3in model, pairs a high-performance processor with a mid-range graphics card. 
The 15.6in model will be available from February, starting at $1,199, and the 17.3in model from April, for an unconfirmed price. 
Specs CPU: Up to seventh generation Intel Core i7 processor Memory: Up to 64GB of DDR4 2,400MHz RAM Display: 15.6in or 17.3in 1920 x 1080 resolution screen, driven by up to Nvidia GTX 1050 GPU in 15.6in version Storage: Up to 512GB SSD and 1TB HDD (17.3in) Ports: 15.6in - Includes USB 3.0, USB 2.0, HDMI. 17.3in - Includes USB Type-C port with Thunderbolt 3 support, USB 3.0, HDMI. Battery life: 93Wh Weight: 15.6in - 2.53kg. 17.3in - 3.79kg Image: Microsoft
